Founder of the Rashtrakuta Dynasty

Dantidurga (also known as Dantivarman II) was the founder of the Rashtrakuta Empire. He ended the power of the Badami Chalukyas and established an independent kingdom in the Deccan. He defeated the Chalukya king Kirtivarman II.

ЁЯПЩя╕П
Capital and Titles

Capital: Manyakheta (early phase Elichpur)
Titles: 'Rajarajadhiraja', 'Parmeshwara', 'Prithivivallabha'.
He performed the 'Hiranyagarbha' (golden womb) Mahadana sacrifice in Ujjain, in which the Pratihara king played the role of a doorkeeper (Pratihara).

тЪФя╕П
Military Victories

He defeated the Pallavas of Kanchi, the kings of Kalinga, Kosala, and Srisailam. His victories laid the foundation for Rashtrakuta dominance in South India.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Architecture

Dantidurga initiated the construction of the 'Dashavatara Temple' at Ellora, which reflects his interest in architecture.
